name: 2-hydrazinobenzothiazole
Reason: 2-hydrazinobenzothiazole has a melting point that is influenced by several functional groups. The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The presence of two phenyl groups and one methoxy group increases the melting point due to the ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. The methoxy group introduces additional rigidity, estimated at around +5 to +10°C. The hydrazine group introduces additional rigidity, estimated at around +20 to +30°C. The thiazole ring introduces additional rigidity, estimated at around +10 to +20°C. The presence of two carbonyl groups (one from the ketone and one from the thiol) can form strong hydrogen bonds and rigidify the structure, contributing around +20 to +40°C for each carbonyl.
